comment.author: 57669468@N00
comment._content: The only Major League Baseball Player to be Killed in Action during World War I. God Bless You and your service, Eddie. www.baseball-reference.com/g/granted01.shtml

comment.author: 8095933@N08
comment._content:
This must have been taken early in the 1913 season, because Grant was traded to the Giants later that season. In fact, a memorial plaque for Grant was erected at the Polo Grounds and remained there until the ballpark was razed.

And regarding the attendance comment -- that was taken during warmups, for one thing, and for another attendance figures were much smaller then (no night baseball, or Sunday ball in some areas). I don't believe a team drew a million until after World War I.
